commText: Gaikwad and Ravindra are at the crease. Gaikwad is on strike. Maxwell will open the attack
Maxwell to Gaikwad, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Maxwell to Gaikwad, out Caught by Yash Dayal!! Maxwell strikes on the first ball, a dream start for RCB. A short ball by the off-spinner and Gaikwad pulls it straight to the fielder at at short fine leg. Taken by Dayal as CSK have an early blow. Gaikwad c Yash Dayal b Maxwell 0(1)
Daryl Mitchell, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Maxwell to Mitchell, 5 wides, loose delivery down the leg-side, a wide ball and the keeper can't gather it, beats him comfortably
Maxwell to Mitchell, 1 run, nudged through mid-wicket by Mitchell for a single to open his account
Maxwell to Ravindra, no run, spinning away from the batter outside off, Ravindra plays it with an open bat face, gets an outside edge to short third man
Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, on the shorter side, Ravindra drags it through square leg for a single
Maxwell to Mitchell, 1 run, on the shorter side, Mitchell nudges it to mid-wicket

Maxwell to Ravindra, FOUR, short ball outside off, Ravindra rocks back and carves it through backward point for four runs. A wicket and 12 runs in the opening over. Hope that wicket doesn't end up being the only happy moment for RCB and RCB fans in this innings
Mohammed Siraj, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Siraj to Mitchell, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler, Mitchell square drives it through backward point for a single
Siraj to Ravindra, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on middle and leg, Ravindra flicks it to wide mid-on where it has been stopped with a dive
Siraj to Mitchell, 1 run, full length delivery on off, driven to mid-off for a single
Siraj to Ravindra, FOUR, Ravindra off to a positive start. This was pitched up by the bowler and Ravindra times his drive through cover-point, just manages to beat the fielder in the deep
Spinner taking a wicket off the first ball of an innings for RCB \nKevin Pietersen v KKR Durban 2009 \nGlenn Maxwell v CSK Bengaluru 2024
Siraj to Ravindra, no run, full length delivery on off, Ravindra drives it to wide mid-off
Siraj to Ravindra, no run, on a length around off, Ravindra drives it to mid-off from within the crease
Yash Dayal, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Yash Dayal to Mitchell, no run, back of a length around off, punched to mid-off by Mitchell
Yash Dayal to Mitchell, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Yash Dayal to Mitchell, out Caught by Kohli!! Huge moment in the game. On a length around off, Mitchell looks to go big, lofts this over mid-off where Kohli sprints across and takes a safe catch. RCB on top! Mitchell looks skywards and grunts in frustration. Mitchell c Kohli b Yash Dayal 4(6)
Ajinkya Rahane, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Yash Dayal to Rahane, no run, on a length outside off, Rahane gets an outside edge to short third man
Yash Dayal to Rahane, no run, back of a length around off, Rahane steers it to backward point
Yash Dayal to Rahane, SIX, on the shorter side, Rahane picks the length early and flicks it over fine leg for half-a-dozen. Opens his account with a maximum
Yash Dayal to Rahane, 1 run, short of a length around off, Rahane taps and runs, quick single taken
Siraj to Rahane, 1 run, played through square leg by Rahane for a single
Siraj to Ravindra, FOUR, short of a length outside off, Ravindra picks the length early, carves it through backward point as the ball rockets away to the boundary. Classy shot
Siraj to Ravindra, no run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Ravindra drives it crisply to mid-off
Siraj to Ravindra, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Ravindra cuts it powerfully to point for a single
Siraj to Rahane, byes, FOUR, banged in short by Siraj, Rahane looks to ramp it, but gets beaten due to the steep bounce. DK can't gather it either and that's four byes
Siraj to Rahane, 3 runs, full toss on the pads, Rahane flicks it through the on-side, stopped by the fielder in the deep, one run saved
Glenn Maxwell [1.0-0-12-1] is back into the attack
Maxwell to Rahane, no run, spins in sharply and Rahane gets a leading edge towards the off-side as he plays it with a closed bat face
Maxwell to Rahane, 1 run, works this short ball towards the leg-side for a single
Maxwell to Ravindra, no run, tad fuller on leg, Ravindra gets an inside edge on to the pads
Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, worked towards mid-wicket by Ravindra for a single
Maxwell to Rahane, 1 run, on a length around middle and leg, nudged through square leg for a single
Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, quicker through the air on off, Ravindra goes for a cut, doesn't middle it though, just a single

Over Summary (1-5 ov) * Maxwell strikes first ball, Ruturaj OUT for a duck * Maxwell still concedes 12 runs in the 1st over * Rachin Ravindra gets going with a couple of crisp boundaries * Yash Dayal strikes, Daryl Mitchell OUT for 4 * Rahane gets going with a superb pull over long leg * Siraj concedes 13 runs in an error-strewn 4th over
Yash Dayal [1.0-0-7-1] is back into the attack
Yash Dayal to Ravindra, FOUR, edged away! Back of a length around off, Ravindra gets an outside edge through the vacant slip region. Only a slip was needed to make things interesting
Yash Dayal to Ravindra, 1 run, back of a length on off, Ravindra cuts it through the off-side for a single
Yash Dayal to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane playing a fine knock. Another surprise. Short of a length around middle and leg, Rahane whips it past the fielder at mid-on. Beats his dive and that's a boundary
Kaushik with this: Some great charades going on between Faf at mid-off and DK, discussing next bowling plans. Lot of pointing at different bowlers, also at batters.
Yash Dayal to Rahane, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahane plays a cracking square cut through point for four runs. Runs coming thick and fast despite the two wickets
Avg opening stand for CSK in IPL 2024 - 21.42 the lowest for them in 15 seasons they featured in IPL (56.60 in IPL 2023 was the highest)
Yash Dayal to Rahane, 1 run, on the pads, nudged through backward square leg for a single
Yash Dayal to Ravindra, 1 run, short of a length outside off, carved through backward point for a single
RCB bowling in Powerplay \nFirst 7 matches: 4 wickets \nLast 7 matches: 19 wickets
Kaushik pings this: A bad throw from the deep had DK backpedalling to catch and he fell awkwardly. He calls for the physio straightaway, he's in trouble. He goes to the other end with a visible limp.
Swapnil Singh, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, 1 run, tossed up full on leg-stump, Ravindra closes the face of the bat too early, thick leading-edge and just wide of Swapnil Singh to his right, lucky there Ravindra
Swapnil Singh to Rahane, 1 run, flighted delivery full on off, Rahane defends with soft hands wide of backward point and it's an easy single
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, 1 run, flat and just outside off, turns back in, back of a length and Ravindra punches wide of cover
Swapnil Singh to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, worked off the back foot to long-on
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, 1 run, fired in on a good length on off, punched to long-off
Swapnil Singh to Rahane, 1 run, just 6 singles off the over. A back of a length delivery on middle, worked to deep mid-wicket
Timeout! CSK behind the rate at this stage but still they have lots of batting left. So they are still very much in the hunt and their only target will be 201 at the moment.
Kaushik pings this during the timeout: RCB get into another big huddle at the sTO. This time it's Kohli doing the talking. Ends with lots of pat on the back for Karn Sharma.
Karn Sharma, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Karn Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, dragged down on the stumps, Rahane mistimes the pull to deep mid-wicket
Karn Sharma to Ravindra, SIX, that's in Ravindra's arc. Lots of flight on the stumps, Ravindra goes low and slogsweeps massively from middle over deep square leg, flies into the crowd
Karn Sharma to Ravindra, 1 run, orthdox leggie on the stumps, length and whipped wide of long-on, Rahane is sent back for the 2nd as Green sends an accurate throw to Karthik
Karn Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up full legbreak outside off, Rahane gets forward to drive, thick inside half rolls down to long-on
Karn Sharma to Ravindra, 1 run, flat and short outside off, flat-batted to long-off and Maxwell gets across and cuts it off
Karn Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, again too much flight and width as well, tossed up outside off, Rahane is allowed to free his arms, lofts inside-out and gives sweeper cover no chance
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, no run, slower and outside off, it grips, Ravindra gets forward to drive, mistimes it back. Karthik likes it as he tells Swapnil Singh that this is very good
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, wide, this is just outside the tramline on the off-side, left alone to take the wide
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, 2 runs, short and wide outside off, carved away wide of sweeper cover and an easy two
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, 1 run, flat dart on leg-stump, tucked to deep mid-wicket
Swapnil Singh to Rahane, 1 run, good length outside off, worked away to deep square leg
Swapnil Singh to Ravindra, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, driven straight to the fielder at sweeper cover
Swapnil Singh to Rahane, 1 run, this low full-toss dips on leg-stump, Rahane flicks it to deep mid-wicket. Another excellent over from Swapnil Singh
Kaushik with this: Kohli and Faf have a long discussion with the two umpires. Not sure what this is about.
Lockie Ferguson, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
Ferguson to Rahane, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Ferguson to Rahane, out Caught by du Plessis!! Ferguson strikes first ball. Was a slower ball full outside off, Rahane gets forward to loft and skies it, Faf from cover goes back and reverse-cups as he tumbles to ground. Ferguson pumps his fist as the leg-cutter does the job. I0$. The stand is broken. Rahane c du Plessis b Ferguson 33(22) [4s-3 6s-1]
Theekshana out and Dube in - CSK make their impact sub change.
Shivam Dube, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, no run, just wide of short cover and that was Kohli. A short of length delivery outside off, stops on Shivam Dube who was aiming to punch, was in the air but just wide
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, no run, short of length and tucks up Shivam Dube with that length on the stumps, neat back foot block
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, no run, Ferguson appeals for a caught behind but that was highly optimistic. Dug in on the stumps, Shivam Dube arches his back and looks for the upper-cut, misses
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, 1 run, slower ball leg-cutter on the stumps, on a length, Shivam Dube makes room and punches wide of cover
Ferguson to Ravindra, 1 run, 2 and a wicket off this over. A slower ball leg-cutter full on the stumps, Ravindra gets forward to drive to long-on

Over Summary (6-10 ov) * Rahane gets CSK the much needed momentum with two boundaries off Dayal * Karn Sharma concedes 14 runs in the 8th over * A couple of tight overs from Swapnil edges RCB slightly ahead * Ferguson strikes off his first ball, Rahane OUT for 33
Glenn Maxwell [2.0-0-16-1] is back into the attack
Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Ravindra goes on the back foot to pull to deep mid-wicket

Maxwell to Shivam Dube, no run, ooh! That has gripped and turned, opens up Shivam Dube on the back foot, hit on the back thigh and only the height saved Shivam Dube there, not even a loud appeal for LBW from RCB
Maxwell to Shivam Dube, 1 run, flat back of a length on the stumps, worked to deep mid-wicket
Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, tossed up full on the stumps, Ravindra makes room and lofts but straight to the fielder at long-off, did not time it
Maxwell to Shivam Dube, no run, beautiful bowling. This slides on straight, fullish and just outside off, Shivam Dube did not have a clue, just pushed at it and is lucky not to outside-edge that
Maxwell to Shivam Dube, 1 run, just 4 off the over. On a good length on the stumps, worked away to deep square leg
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short of length on the ribcage, worked away to deep backward square leg
Ferguson to Ravindra, no ball, FOUR, the knuckle-ball slips out and it's at the head of Ravindra, high low full-toss and Ravindra gets it down to the fine-leg fence

Faf, Kohli and Ferguson have a chat with umpire Akshay Totre. They are not happy that this slippery ball is not being changed. The ump shakes his head and now the other umpire KN Anantha Padmanabhan gets involved. Still not enough to change the ball. Meanwhile a free-hit for Ravindra.

Ferguson to Ravindra, SIX, bad couple of balls for RCB. It's 50 for Ravindra. His 1st and what a time to get it. Another low full-toss on the stumps, Ravindra swipes it and just clears the leaping deep mid-wicket. Did not get all of it but had enough

Ferguson to Ravindra, SIX, superb batting and suddenly CSK have the momentum. A short delivery outside off with no third man back, easy for Ravindra who opens the face of the bat and ramps all the way
Chants of "CSK" and the RCB fans try to drown it out with their own "RCB" chants.
Ferguson round the wicket now.
Ferguson to Ravindra, 1 run, a slower ball leg-cutter on a length outside off, driven to deep point
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, no run, tight length delivery on the stumps, seam-up and driven straight to the fielder at short cover
Ferguson to Shivam Dube, no run, no room and again hitting the bat hard is Ferguson, fullish and Shivam Dube meekly drives to short cover. Takes a look at his bat after that
Maxwell to Ravindra, no run, flat and back of a length on the stumps, Ravindra goes on the back foot to pull and misses, hit on the body

Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, just wide of Faf at extra-cover and well in front of long-off running in. Fullish on the stumps, Ravindra makes room to loft and it's a top-edge that swirls around, Faf tried his bat but the ball fell in no-man's land

Maxwell to Shivam Dube, 1 run, dropped by Siraj from long-on. Well tossed up on the stumps, lands hsort of the lofting length, Shivam Dube goes for a big hit, thick top-edge goes a long way and Siraj calls for it, runs in and gets hands on it, but it slips out and rolls through the thigh and down to the boot, and to the ground. Kohli can't believe it. How big a moment this will be?
Maxwell to Ravindra, 1 run, flat back of a length on the stumps, Ravindra on the pull gets a thick inside-edge and Yash Dayal at short fine-leg saves runs with a dive to his left, saved three
Maxwell to Shivam Dube, 1 run, tossed up full on the stumps, Shivam Dube makes room to loft on the bounce to long-off
Maxwell to Ravindra, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!

Maxwell to Ravindra, out Ravindra Run Out!! 1 run completed. The set batter goes. Flat good length on leg-stump, tucked wide of deep backward square leg and the call was for two, but Ravindra was slow, Shivam Dube was always going for it, in the end Ravindra had to sacrifice himself. Easy run-out in the end. Ravindra apologises to Dube on the way back. The crowd back to their full voice. Replays show that Ravindra when going for the 2nd, took a couple of steps and then stopped. Dube never did. Ravindra run out (Swapnil Singh/Karthik) 61(37) [4s-5 6s-3]
Ravindra Jadeja, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Cameron Green, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short of length and off-pace just outside off, Shivam Dube punches wide of backward point for one

Green to Jadeja, 2 runs, dropped by Karthik. Cross-seam length delivery just outside off, Jadeja gloves it and Karthik is late to go down, his outstretched left hand is there but the ball does not stick, just about carried

Green to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, had backward point looked up and saw, there was a chance to run Jadeja out. Swapnil the man. A length delivery outside the leg-stump, squares up Jadeja, off the pad and Jadeja was nowhere in the picture, again Shivam Dube running full steam, Swapnil throws at the striker's end and the chance goes
Green to Shivam Dube, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Green to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Ferguson!! Great planning against Shivam Dube and it has worked. Nothing in his zone and the dangerous hitter goes. A slower ball off-cutter outside off, on a length, Shivam Dube pulls but doesn't get the elevation, holes out to long-on. Simple catch and Kohli is pumped. Shivam Dube c Ferguson b Green 7(15)
Mitchell Santner, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Green to Santner, wide, down leg, Santner flicks and misses, a wide
Green to Santner, 1 run, short of length on off, pushed wide of backward point
Green to Jadeja, FOUR, that should have been stopped by Faf at mid-off. Full outside off, driven well and a half-stop but not good enough on the dive to his right
Kaushik pings this: Suyash Prabhudessai on the field for Maxwell.
Mohammed Siraj [2.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack
Siraj to Santner, 1 run, fullish on off, pushed wide of backward point for a quick single
Siraj to Jadeja, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter on a length on the stumps, worked to deep mid-wicket
Siraj to Santner, 1 run, full on off, driven over the leaping outstretched right hand of Siraj
Siraj to Jadeja, no run, good short ball outside off, with oomph and pace, left alone and Karthik leaps to collect
Siraj to Jadeja, 1 run, dug in short as Jadeja gives the charge and he cuts, in the air and just short of Lockie at sweeper cover
Siraj to Santner, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Siraj to Santner, out Caught by du Plessis!! Corker from Faf at mid-off and the roof is coming down at the Chinnaswamy. What a catch. A low full-toss on off, Santner leaning back lofts and Faf at the edge of the ring, leaps at the right time and at full stretch the ball sticks in the outstretched right hand. The usually phlegmatic Santner just goes off looking stoic. The entire RCB team run to crowd Faf who's milking it all in. On second glance, Faf took it behind him and that is one of the catches of this season, if not the best. Santner c du Plessis b Siraj 3(4)
MS Dhoni, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Over Summary (11-15 ov) * An expensive 12th over from Ferguson tilts the game back in CSK's favour, he conceded 19 runs * Shivam Dube dropped by Siraj off Maxwell on 4 * A terrible mix-up and Rachin Ravindra is run-out for 61 * Karthik drops a tough chance off Jadeja on 0 * Dube holes out to long-on off Green, OUT for 7 * A screamer from Faf du Plessis, Santner OUT for 3
Green to Jadeja, 1 run, full on the stumps, Jadeja gets forward to drive to long-on
Green to Dhoni, no run, length delivery and angling into off-stump, pushed back
Green to Dhoni, 2 runs, short of length and angling into off and middle, worked away wide of short fine-leg and by the time deep backward square leg comes around, Dhoni has come back for the 2nd
Chants of "Dhoni" echo around the ground now.
Green to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length and on middle, worked away to deep backward square leg
Green to Jadeja, 1 run, good short ball at Jadeja, he is cramped and miscues the pull just wide of mid-wicket
Green to Dhoni, FOUR, short and at Dhoni who gets inside the line and pulls, fine of short fine-leg and Faf is not happy, runs away for four

Timeout! This is perfectly set up for a Dhoni special. We have seen it many times before in IPL and for India. But can he do it one more time? If he does so, then it will be heartbreak for those RCB fans at the ground and delirium for CSK fans. The equation though is difficult - 63 in 24 balls. But if there's one man you would want to bet against it's that man from Jharkhand.
Yash Dayal [2.0-0-22-1] is back into the attack
Yash Dayal to Jadeja, SIX, great hit and a good start for CSK. A back of the hand slower ball full outside off, in the slot, Jadeja lofts clean and high over long-off
Yash Dayal to Jadeja, no run, good comeback from Yash Dayal. Seam-up and full outside off, Jadeja drives and misses, under the bat
Dhoni goes to Jadeja to have a word.
Yash Dayal to Jadeja, 1 run, a low full-toss on the stumps, driven to long-on and it's just one
Yash Dayal to Dhoni, FOUR, poor delivery and four. The low full-toss is down leg, short fine-leg is in and Dhoni glances for four well wide of the man
Yash Dayal to Dhoni, 1 run, back of the hand slower ball on a length on off, glided for one to short third man
Yash Dayal to Jadeja, 1 run, another back of the hand slower ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover and it's just one, Jadeja retains the strike with that run
Who will bowl the three overs? Siraj has one. Lockie two. Yash Dayal one. Green two. It has to be between these four. Can't see any others.
Mohammed Siraj [3.0-0-20-1] is back into the attack
Siraj to Jadeja, SIX, a half-volley on the stumps, Jadeja did not get all of it, but just enough on the loft, clears the leaping long-off. Another good start to the over
Remember Maxwell is not on the field. Suyash is there, he is at long-off.

Siraj to Jadeja, 2 runs, that's sloppy from Kohli and Siraj is caught napping as well. A slower ball off-cutter dug in across Jadeja who pulls to the square leg region, the batters were happy with one, Kohli needlessly throws and Siraj was walking back to his mark, unaware of the throw coming in, no backing up and they go back for two. Kohli is not happy and tells something to Siraj I guess

Siraj to Jadeja, no run, full and wide outside off, Jadeja reaches for it and under-edges the drive on the bounce to Karthik, a precious dot and Siraj stares at Jadeja for a good 3-4 seconds before walking back

Siraj to Jadeja, FOUR, Dhoni walked up to Jadeja to have a word after the last ball. This is short and wide outside off, backward point is in and sweeper cover is well wide, cut away for four, again Dhoni is in Jadeja's ear
A change of field - deep backward point back. Third man and fine-leg up.
Siraj to Jadeja, 1 run, dug in short at Jadeja, who pulls in front of Green at long-on and even though Jadeja wants two, Dhoni is happy with one
13 off the over. Mid-off up.
Siraj to Dhoni, wide, this is atrocious from Siraj. Dug in so short and it's a humongous wide, left alone and Karthik leaps to collect. Why would you try that now?
Another change of field. Long-off is there.
Siraj to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length just outside off, punched wide of backward point and it's just one, Dhoni will take strike next over

My guess is that Yash Dayal and Lockie will bowl these two overs. Unless Faf throws the ball to Green. 35 off 12 is a steep task but it can be done. And don't rule out anything when it comes to CSK v RCB clashes. Remember Albie Morkel vs Kohli?, all those years ago. It is Lockie.
Lockie Ferguson [2.0-0-21-1] is back into the attack

Ferguson to Dhoni, no ball, once again Ferguson with a beamer. Again it has slipped out of his hand. Second time that Ferguson has bowled one over the waist on the full, the umps have a chat. They don't consider it to be risking the batter, so Ferguson will continue. Was way over the head and had Dhoni got any bat, would have run away
Now a free-hit for Dhoni.
Ferguson to Dhoni, 1 run, fullish on off, Dhoni heaves and it's miscued, just a single to deep mid-wicket

Ferguson to Jadeja, FOUR, bad bowling and not bowling to the field. A short of length delivery down leg, easy for Jadeja who whips it to the deep backward square leg fence, practice wickets and it runs away. Jadeja watching the ball and he bumps into Ferguson, nothing alarming though
Jadeja takes his helmet off and there's a mini breather here. 29 off 10. Tense faces everywhere. You could cut the tension with a knife at the Chinnaswamy.
Ferguson to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length and tucks up Jadeja on the stumps, he can't free his arms, flicked to deep mid-wicket and it's just one

Ferguson to Dhoni, FOUR, four more. Fullish outside off, width and Dhoni with those fast hands, gets forward and lofts over extra-cover, no chance for sweeper cover. Was bowled at 145ks and went at around 160 off the bat
Ferguson to Dhoni, 1 run, good ball, short of length and tucks up Dhoni on the body, mistimed pull to deep square leg and Dhoni gives the strike to Jadeja
23 off 7, Dhoni goes to Jadeja to have a word.

Ferguson to Jadeja, SIX, that's what CSK wanted and Jadeja wants something as he signals to the dugout. A short of length delivery around off, seam-up and that hard length, Jadeja knew this was coming, sits on the back foot and pulls to the crowd at deep mid-wicket, really got hold of it. 18 off the over
17 off the last and who will it be? Green or Yash Dayal? Big call this. This is a fantastic game and we have a grandstand finish here. It will be Yash Dayal to bowl. Can he hold his nerve?
Yash Dayal [3.0-0-35-1] is back into the attack

Yash Dayal to Dhoni, SIX, MS Dhoni - remember the legend! This has gone over the roof at the ground over fine-leg. A low full-toss on leg-stump, Dhoni swings and it's a massive massive hit. 110m and it goes over the roof. The CSK supporters go mad
Now 11 off 5. Pressure on Yash Dayal.
Yash Dayal to Dhoni, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Yash Dayal to Dhoni, out Caught by Swapnil Singh!! And Yash Dayal responds with a wicket. End of Dhoni. It's the back of the hand slower ball on the stumps, Dhoni swipes and it's a fat top-edge, straight up and how cool was Swapnil at deep backward square leg under that, takes it nonchalantly and gives his side the edge. Yash Dayal has his arms aloft in celebration. Now it's the turn of RCB to celebrate. After the catch was taken, Dhoni punched his bat in frustration and muttered something to himself, looking disappointed, before walking away. Dhoni c Swapnil Singh b Yash Dayal 25(13) [4s-3 6s-1]
Shardul Thakur, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Yash Dayal to Thakur, no run, a big dot. A back of the hand slower ball dug in, Thakur swipes and misses, Karthik prevents the bye and Jadeja is watching all this from the other end
11 off 3 and must say RCB heavy favorites here. Kohli comes to Yash Dayal to have a word. Faf is meanwhile setting the field.
Yash Dayal to Thakur, 1 run, a back of the hand slower ball on the stumps, Thakur slogs and it's a thick outside-edge to short third man, just one and more importantly Jadeja is on strike
10 off 2. The same equation in the final last year. Jadeja did it against Mohit. Can he do it again? Can Yash Dayal not bowl an extra?

Yash Dayal to Jadeja, no run, look at Yash Dayal and the others celebrating! They know just a legal delivery will do now. A back of the hand slower ball outside off, Jadeja swipes and misses, inside the tramline and it's a dot. Yash Dayal is near Karthik and jumping up and down. Kohli is fist-pumping in delight and the crowd go mental

Yash Dayal to Jadeja, no run, CSK knocked out! RCB qualify. Take a bow Yash Dayal. He was the much maligned bowler after Rinku Singh hit him for five consecutive sixes to win an improbable game. Ever since he has been down, but tonight it's his redemption story. His life has come full circle and he must be the happiest man on the planet right now. Sports gives us these moments. When you have a chance to turn things around. And what a turnaround this has been for Yash Dayal, imagine the pressure he must have been under - after that out of the roof six against MSD first ball. And suddenly all those old demons would have come back to speak to him in his head. Under extreme pressure against arguably the greatest finisher the game has ever seen, with zero room to hide anywhere, he gets him out and takes his side to the playoffs. So celebrate Yash Dayal tonight, RCB fans. Coming back to the last ball, another back of the hand slower ball dug in outside off, Jadeja swipes and misses. And the celebrations begin, the reactions of Kohli who nearly had his eye sockets pop out as he punches the air, Faf hugging Kohli, Anushka Sharma double fist-pumping and the crowd raising the decibel levels to such a notch that it could be heard from Kathriguppe to Cubbon Park. A game that certainly lived up to its billing and the packed Chinnaswamy will talk about this game for ages to come

00:09 Local Time, 18:39 GMT, 00:09 IST: Finally RCB get one over CSK in a knockout game. It has been often the men in yellow who have had the wood over the men in red but it's redemption time for RCB tonight. They set the tone with the bat as everyone batted well to give their side 218 and then Maxwell struck first ball to remove Gaikwad to give them a dream start. The plans to Dube was spot-on and the dangerous left-hander was nipped out for a low score. The partnership between Rahane and Ravindra set the innings back on track but Lockie struck first ball to remove the former. Ravindra was run-out after a mix-up with Dube and one can now say that was the turning point of the game. Jadeja though did not give up and once again looked set to break RCB hearts as he struck them cleanly. And that man MSD threatened as well, that six over the roof at fine-leg would have brought back all the horror memories for RCB fans when CSK would win from nowhere. But credit to Yash Dayal who showed a cool head and forced a top-edge that got MS and from then he kept nailing the back of the hand slower balls and eventually took his side home. The crowd's reaction when RCB won must have been the loudest it has ever been as they milked it all in. So 6 on the trot for RCB and they make the playoffs. Meanwhile a rare setback for CSK as they fail to make it to the last four. Stay tuned for the presentations...

They are showing the celebrations again - and funnily Maxwell who was off the field after his spell is jumping up and down as soon as the match ended and Kohli I saw shed a tear or two. Overcome with emotion he was. MSD meanwhile watching on from the dugout as usual did not give anything away, just blinked his eyes a couple of times, looked straight ahead and was stoic. What contrasting emotions and what a match.

Lockie Ferguson - Unbelievable, not sure how to put in words, complete team effort, wasn't easy to bowl at the end, it was very wet. Yash, to get rid of MS and get the job done, it was amazing. It's the nature of bowling here, mix it up and keep the batters guessing. There's a bit of spin as well and we needed to keep the batters guessing. In the end, we got the job done. If I could rewind time (on asking why he didn't bowl a yorker in the 19th over), but the wicket was doing a bit when bowled on a length. We know how good Jaddu is with the yorker ball, but perhaps we could have tried to. Thankful to Yash for getting the job done.

Ruturaj Gaikwad: I think it was a good wicket to be honest, it was spinning and gripping a little bit, but I think 200 on this ground was gettable. We kept losing wickets at regular intervals, it was a matter of one or two hits, sometimes that can happen in a T20 game. Pretty happy with what the target was, to sum up the season, I am pretty happy to have seven wins out of 14 games. Just couldn't get over the line in the last two balls. With the kind of injuries we had, missing out on two frontline bowlers, not having Conway at the top of the order as well, I think missing out on three key players made a huge difference. Credit to the CSK staff and everyone who put up a great show for us throughout the season. There were many challenges for us right throughout the first game. Injury to Fizz (Mustafizur), then injury to Pathirana as well, he came back and then again Pathirana missed out. When you have injuries around, you have to get that balance in the team and pick it (the team) for every game. I think this season sums up well where we had to tinker around with our playing XI, considering the injuries and all the illness (of the players) as well. Happy with the seven wins, couldn't get over the line though. Happy with it. We got 10 from the last 2 balls in our last knockout game last year so this was a similar situation, things didn't go our way (this season) though. For me, personal milestones don't really matter a lot, after all the ultimate goal is to win. If you are not getting there it's a disappointment. Doesn't matter if you score 100 runs or 500-600 runs in a season. I am disappointed (after losing.)

RCB becomes the first side to have sequences of six successive wins and six successive defeats each in the same season. Deccan Chargers in 2010, PBKS in 2020 and SRH in 2022 have had sequence of five consecutive wins and defeats each.

The last time RCB made it to the Playoffs with Chinnaswamy Stadium as their home base was in IPL 2016. Like this season, they came back from 2-5 at the halfway mark to winning six of the last seven league games.
RCB has become the first side ever to qualify for the Playoffs after having just a solitary win in their first seven games of a season.
Most consecutive wins for RCB (IPL) 7 in 2011 (Runners up) 6 in 2024 5 in 2009 (Runners up) 5 in 2016 (Runners up)
Stats round-up by Deepu Narayanan

Faf du Plessis | RCB captain and Player of the Match: What a night. Unbelievable and such a great atmosphere, such a pleasure to finish off the season at home with a win. Batting first, I think it was the hardest pitch I have ever played on in T20s. Myself and Virat were talking about 140-150 after we came back from the rain break. The communication from the umpires was there was a lot of rain on the pitch, they wanted to push the game and that makes sense. When we came back, my goodness, I was telling Mitch Santner it was like a day 5 Test match at Ranchi and to get 200 on that was unbelievable. The last 6 games the batters have batted with good intent and good strike-rate. We were slow earlier on and we wanted more intent and that was awesome. We were defending 175, it got a bit close, at one stage, with MS there, I thought, oh dear, he has done it so many times. The way we bowled with the wet ball was unbelievable, we tried to change it. I dedicate this Man of the Match to Yash Dayal. The way he bowled was unbelievable. For a man who's fairly new, he deserves it. [on what he told Dayal before the last over] Pace off is the best option on this pitch and trust your skills and enjoy, this is what you trained for. The yorker did not work the 1st ball and he went back to pace off and it worked unbelievably well. [on the crowd tonight] It's crazy, even when we weren't winning the fans were here. We in the changeroom we felt it was something we had to get right. Coming here tonight, it was set up nicely, CSK v RCB, unbelievable atmosphere and we as a team will do a lap of honour to thank the crowd for the support. It's really important that we enjoy this, great 6 games in a row and the first goal in the IPL is to get into the knockouts and we have done that, enjoy this but get back to work tomorrow.

RCB doing a lap of honour to thank the crowd as Faf promised he would do. Not many would have left the ground for sure tonight. Such a thrilling game and the partisan RCB crowd get what they wanted - their side into the playoffs at the expense of CSK. 6 on the trot for RCB and they are a side bubbling with momentum. They will go to Ahmedabad to play the Eliminator and will wait to face their opponents. That will be known tomorrow. On that note we sign off. It's been a pleasure to bring you the coverage of this. Hope you enjoyed it. The cricket continues and there's no respite. We will be back tomorrow. On behalf of Nikhil Jadhav, Pradeep Krishnamurthy and Harish Vutakuru our scorer, this is me (Srivathsa) signing off. Remember to sleep tight and smile. Bye.
